head.title: These Unlikely Neighbors Won't Have Much to Say

hedline.hl1: These Unlikely Neighbors Won't Have Much to Say

abstract.p: London representatives of three rival American buyout firms will all occupy same building in fashionable St James district: Texas Pacific Group, Blackstone Group and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts; secrecy will become more important to all three (S)

block.p: Is the scramble for a European foothold spurring an unlikely chumminess among American buyout firms? Later this year, according to people who know those involved, the London representatives of both the Texas Pacific Group, founded by David Bonderman and James G. Coulter, and the Blackstone Group, led by Pete Peterson, plan to move into the same seven-story building, called Stirling Square, in the fashionable St. James's district that already houses Henry Kravis's company, Kohlberg Kravis Roberts. Given that the three firms will be competing for the same slices of the European action, this could mean more attention to secrecy. Most of the principals aren't commenting. But a person familiar with the set-up vouchsafed, ''We won't be talking too much in the elevators.''
